definition: Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]

sentences.english: Welcome to Geneva, and welcome to a consultation with a transformative ambition.
sentences.chinese: 欢迎你们来日内瓦参加这次锐意改革的协商会议。

sentences.english: Sharp intention cures, utterly loyal, is a talented individual on the political.
sentences.chinese: 锐意图治，忠心耿耿，政治上是一位干才。

sentences.english: Why emphasis on making pressure-blasting machine industry needs unceasingly innovation?
sentences.chinese: 为什么重点强调制砂机行业需要锐意的创新呢？

sentences.english: We support the aggressive development and recruitment of the best people .
sentences.chinese: 我们支持锐意发展和招聘最佳人才。

sentences.english: Yawei people who are steadily developing are expecting to advance together with you for achieving another brilliance.
sentences.chinese: 锐意进取的雅崴人期待与您携手迸进，共创辉煌。

sentences.english: I"m afraid Idon"t know. Let me ask the supervisor in this section.
sentences.chinese: 只怕我不明白，让我来扣问一下该组的锐意人。

sentences.english: Forge ahead, never complacency is my motto.
sentences.chinese: 锐意进取，永不自满是我的座右铭。

sentences.english: Facing the solemn duty badge, we will forge ahead.
sentences.chinese: 面对庄严的税徽，我们要锐意进取。

definition: to show initiative/to be a go-getter/to push forward with one's agenda
to preserve the accomplishments of previous generations/to carry on the good work of one's predecessors
to rouse to vigorous action/energetic mood
to work from morning to night (idiom)
lit. to ride the wind and crest the waves/to be ambitious and unafraid (idiom)
see 發揚踔厲|发扬踔厉[fa1 yang2 chuo1 li4]
to carry out (obligation) conscientiously/to behave sincerely
to discard the old and introduce the new (idiom); to innovate
